str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To put to the test, make trial of, tempt, try. From ek and peirazo; to test thoroughly.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
